title: Zac - Lowest Win Rate
body:
So when can we get Zac reverted Riot?

He has a 43% win rate today in ranked on NA.

Please dont bother throwing buffs at this awful kit and just give us back the old Zac.

I havent came across one person that likes the new Zac.

You guys ruined a champion, swallow your pride and admit it.

replies.body:
Legit every zac player i've talked to hates his ult. 
With the Q buffs and E changes I think he'll be ok, but his ult will still be entirely useless. 
I'd be happy if they just reverted the ult change and kept the q buffs and work on bugfixes for it.

I don't think the ult will be useless after the changes that are on the pbe, the e giving a knockup for a full second when you charge it gives the enemy 0.1 seconds after the cc ends to get out of it, so unless they blow flash they end up getting pulled fairly reliably

Those changes wont give the ultimate back the 60%+ damage that was taken away in the rework.  Those changes wont make the ultimate as dynamic and useful both for offense and defense that the old ultimate had.  Being able to use a shitty ultimate more reliably doesn't make that ultimate any less shitty.

Skill isn't the main issue, he's just inane and impractical now. 

He does not, WILL not act as an initiator now. Maybe if the teamfight's already well under way you can do something, but no, you DON'T go i

His Q and R actually doing anything predicates on the enemy team NOT doing anything like simply moving a little bit, turning around and unloading on you while you uselessly run away or toward them to try to even land the FIRST Q on something.

I think the intention was to fork the enemy team on either focussing your passive blobs or your team while your team presumably jumps in to lay the smackdown and you hopefully survive to reform and ult in the middle of it.

But you need to be pretty strong to even matter in this capacity either way. GOOD LUCK getting there with this useless set of abilities in the first place.

Zac is completely team reliant and simply outclassed by everything else in the game now.

I don't know why they changed Zac's ult in the first place, it was already one of the most unique abilities in the game. I think Scarra's video previewing the mid-season changes wraps up a lot of the community's reaction to the Zac rework. Unfortunately Riot will most likely not revert the rework since they put so much time into it that they would consider it a huge loss to lose all the work they put into him. It's a shame that they can be so stubborn with these class reworks when they don't go as well as hoped. As a Rengar player myself who can't stand playing him after his rework, I truly feel terrible for Zac mains who definitely got the short end of the stick when it came to this mid-season's reworks and will be stuck with what they got for a long time to come.

His ult might be garbage but I've seen a lot of people agree with me on liking the new Q mechanically, even if it's really weak numerically at the moment. He might be weak but there's no reason to revert the Q change withot seeing if it might be good in the future with the incoming buffs.

The consesus on the ult is that it's too situational to be good however, so that might be up for a revert if anything.

Yeah, the consensus on r/thesecretweapon is fix the Q, revert the ultimate.  The new Q is very satisfying when it works, but right now, it has a lot of kinks that need to be worked out before it is a good tool for Zac.
they will revert zac the same day they will revert malzahar and they admit they messed up

If we followed your mentality, we would never get anywhere.

Give them time to fix it before crying wolf.
I'm okay with the kit changes and I still absolutely refuse to play him because they ruined his voice with that unfunny joke.

What is your sample size for people you've asked about the new zac? 

It is going to be lower because he takes more skill now and people are going to have to figure out how to play him. In addition to this fact there is the point that a bunch of n00bs are going to try and play him but they will suck and drag his winrate down.
